etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Thomas Thomson. From the name of K. W. Nose, German geologist who described the mineral + -an, after German Nosian

definitions: A mineral of the sodalite group, a silicate and sulphate of sodium and aluminium, Na₈ Al₆ Si₆ O₂₄ (SO₄), that crystallizes in the cubic system and occurs in phonolites and related volcanic rocks. Compare noselite, "nosin".
